title: Top Chinese Tutoring Company Laid Off 60,000 Workers After Crackdown
sub_head: New Oriental pivots to live-streaming sales of farm products and to other kinds of teaching
body:
New Oriental Education & Technology Group Inc., one of the largest after-school tutoring companies in China, let go of 60,000 staff in 2021 after a drastic regulatory crackdown on the sector.
The company also incurred nearly 20 billion yuan, the equivalent of $3.1 billion, of expenses, company founder and Chairman Michael Yu said in a Saturday post on a personal social-media account. The costs covered returning prepaid tuition, severance payments and breaking leases on existing teaching space.
